idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

descript.abstract: World Cities is a point theme representing the locations of major cities of the world. Attribute information includes the name, country and population classification of the city. This dataset is a part of the 2010 ESRI Data and Maps Collection
descript.purpose: World Cities provides a base map layer of the cities for the world. The cities include national capitals, provincial capitals, major population centers, and landmark cities.
descript.supplinf:
Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:15,000,000.
This dataset comes with an ESRI layer file symbolizing the features.

citeinfo.title: World Cities, 2010
citeinfo.origin: Economic and Social Research Institute (Reston, Va.)

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent the locations of the major cities of the world.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The administrative unit code (three-letter country code, three-letter administrative unit code) for the administrative unit in which the city is located.
The name of the administrative unit in which the city is located.
The FIPS code (two-letter) for the country in which the city is located.

attr.attrdef: The name for the country in which the city is located.

The classification of the city based on its population.
The Port Identification Number for the city.

edom.edomvd: This name is not duplicated in another layer.
This name is duplicated in another layer.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI® software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

procstep.procdesc:
The following steps were performed by ESRI for Data & Maps 2002: Moved Mangyshlak to its correct location. Updated Fips_cntry and Cntry_name attributes for East Timor, Yugoslavia and their capitals. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr) and ArcView GIS legend file (.avl). Copied projection file (.prj) and created spatial indices.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted the features from ArcWorld Supplement. Updated by adding/deleting features and changing attribute values, based on political changes and other factors. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr). Created ArcView GIS legend file (.avl). Created projection file (.prj). Created spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Added one city each to West Bank and Gaza Strip. Added or recorded provincial capitals for South Africa. Corrected spellings of two cities. Changed Yugoslavia to Serbia & Montenegro. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated attribute values for East Timor and Taiwan. Added LABEL_FLAG attribute to assist in the display of the map documents (.mxd).
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Reduced the attribute widths for CITY_NAME and CNTRY_NAME.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Edited the STATUS and CITY_NAME attributes based on referencing the CAPITAL attribute in World Country Memberships of Political Organizations (table).
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated ADMIN_NAME for Paris. Updated country attributes for Belgrade (Serbia) and Podgorica (Montenegro). Changed city Kiev to Kyiv.

citeinfo.title: GeoNames, 2010
citeinfo.othercit: Provides the source for the population-based attributes. Downloaded the data in November 2009.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Corrected the domain values for the POP_CLASS attribute. Updated the names for four cities. Converted the data set to SDC. Created projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Downloaded the data from the GeoNames web site. Added the POP field and calculated city population values from the GeoNames data. Calculated the POP field to -999 (Unknown) for cities that didn't find a match in the GeoNames data or didn't have a population value. Recalculated the existing POP_RANK and POP_CLASS fields from the POP field. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was extracted from the ArcWorld Supplement database. No detailed evaluation of the positional accuracy of the ArcWorld Supplement data has been made; knowledge of the source World Data Bank II (WDBII) data is insufficient to determine positional accuracy of data derived from the source.

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either tools in ArcGIS or ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2). The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify and validate the geometry. The data set is created directly from a topologically correct ArcInfo® coverage.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
